title: If human perception of the sensible world is phenomenological in nature, how would it be possible to obtain to scientific objective certainty without encountering an insurmountable contradiction in terms? - Quora

response.answer_text: Humans need to be reasonably certain where their next meal is coming from, where they can safely sleep, and that their friends and family are currently safe and uninjured. If your perceptions are achieving that for you, then you’re doing pretty well. There are plenty of scientific discoveries which I am certain enough of to stake my own life and my children’s lives on. If there’s any level of certainty greater than that, I don’t need it.
